images.caption: Figure 1:Visualization of Block Drop. where we useto denote the blocks with high similarity scores (i.e., low importance scores). The dropped blocks areblurred.

Figure 4:Visualization of Layer Drop, where we visualize dropping either MLP or Attention Layers. Given the residual connection, we take LayerNorm together with the corresponding layers. The dropped layers with high similarity scores (i.e., low importance scores)areblurred.

Figure 10:Visualization of Importance Scores in Checkpoints during the Pre-training Process of MAP-Neo-7B, wherelighter areasrepresent low importance scores (i.e., high similarity scores).
We present
the entire Training Process (checkpoints for every 500B trained tokens).
We independently visualize the importance scores at the module index 0, since they are significantly higher.

header: 7Joint Layer Drop Further Enhances the Performance

images.caption:
Figure 12:Ablation Study on Dropping Strategies,
i.e., Iterative and One-Shot, where One-Shot Dropping achieves comparable performance with Iterative Dropping.
